#summary All open9x compilations options

= Introduction =

We will soon run out of flash, and it will be difficult to enable all options in the same time. Here is the list of all options available in open9x so that you may choose the ones that you need / want.

To compile the firmware here is the syntax:
{{{
make OPTION1=VALUE1 OPTION2=VALUE2...
}}}

= Options =
<code language="xml">
PCB *STD* / V4</code>
Either the stock PCB or the gruvin9x v4 board
<br><br>

<code language="xml">EXT *STD* / FRSKY / JETI</code>
Telemetry extension
<br><br>

<code language="xml">TRANSLATIONS *EN* / FR</code>
Strings translations
<br><br>

<code language="xml">HELI YES / *NO*</code>
Heli support and menus
<br><br>

<code language="xml">TEMPLATES *YES* / NO</code>
Templates screen enabled
<br><br>

<code language="xml">NAVIGATION NO / *POTS* / RE1</code>
Pots use in menus navigation
<br><br>

<code language="xml">BEEPER *BUZZER* / BUZZER_MOD / SPEAKER</code>
How the sounds are sent
<br><br>

<code language="xml">SPLASH *YES* / NO</code>
Splash displayed on Tx start
<br><br>

<code language="xml">BATT BANDGAP / *UNSTABLE_BANDGAP*</code>
Awaiting description
<br><br>

<code language="xml">DECIMALS *YES* / NO</code>
Decimals displayed in outputs values
<br><br>

<code language="xml">FRSKY_HUB *YES* / NO</code>
!FrSky Hub supported (when EXT=FRSKY)
<br><br>

<code language="xml">WS_HOW_HIGH *YES* / NO</code>
Winged Shadow How High supported (when EXT=FRSKY)
<br><br>

<code language="xml">LOGS *YES* / NO</code>
When V4 board used: logs enabled on SD-card
<br><br>

<code language="xml">SOMO *NO* / YES</code>
When V4 board used: SOMO-14D board support
<br><br>

<code language="xml">DSM2 *NO* / SERIAL / PPM</code>
DSM2 protocol
<br><br>

<code language="xml">PXX *NO* / YES</code>
Port from er9x in progress...
<br><br>

<code language="xml">SILVER *NO* / YES</code>
Silverlit Protocol
<br><br>

<code language="xml">CTP1009 *NO* / YES</code>
CTP1009 Protocol
